title: Nail-biting moment a Utah trooper drags an unconscious driver from his car
text:
Dramatic footage shows the moment a Utah trooper dragged an unconscious driver from his car seconds before a train smashes into the vehicle.

Utah Highway Patrol Trooper Ruben Correa approached a car stopped on tracks while he at a a traffic stop on the I-15 in Farmington on Wednesday morning at 6.50pm.

He was responding to a call of a car on the tracks and knew he had to act fast when he noticed the driver was slumped inside the vehicle.

Dramatic footage shows the moment a Utah trooper dragged an unconscious driver from his cars seconds before a train smashes into the vehicle

Footage shows Correa parking his car on a grass verge before running towards the car, as the train is seen directly approaching it.

He then manages to get the driver out as the train smashes into the car, throwing it at least a 30 foot distance ahead on the tracks.

The incident took place on the FrontRunner tracks between Pages Lane and Parrish Lane in Davis County, a Utah Transit Authority spokesman said. Thankfully no injuries were reported during the incident.

Utah Highway Patrol Trooper Ruben Correa was responding to a call of a car on the tracks and knew he had to act fast when he noticed the driver was slumped inside the vehicle

Footage shows Correa parking his car on a grass verge before running towards the car, as the train is seen directly approaching it

The brave officer told KSL: 'At that point, I actually wasn’t really thinking, I was just doing my job.

He used his spotlight to find the car and told dispatchers when he found it on the southbound side of the freeway.

He explained that he ran over to the car on the tracks and opened the door, noticing the unconscious driver still inside.

He then dragged the unresponsive driver onto an embankment next to the tracks, having put his own life in danger also.

Pictured above is the moment the train smashes into the car just seconds after the state trooper removed the unconscious man from the car

Correa can be seen standing with the man as the train smashed into his car with seconds left to spare

Utah Highway Patrol Trooper Ruben Correa approached a car stuck on tracks while at a a traffic stop on northbound I-15 in Farmington on Wednesday morning

He added: 'I heard the horn from the train and was able to observe that train was coming pretty fast, anywhere between 50 and 80 miles an hour, so at that point I was a little bit concerned about that.

'That's when I realized: 'Oh wow, that was a lot closer than what I would have liked.

'I'm still trying to process everything that happened. I'm just very grateful that I was able to get him out and he's alive and he's back with his family now.'

He said be believed the driver had a 'possible unknown medical condition' and he was a 'deadweight' when he removed him from the vehicle.

Correa claimed that he was able to talk to the drive afterwards and both men said they were extremely fortunate that they were safe and uninjured.

Since footage of the incident was uploaded on Wednesday morning, it has been viewed more than 72,000 times.

Thousands of users have been quick to praise the bravery of Ruben Correa for saving the man's life. Utah Highway Patrol posted footage of the rescue with the caption: 'Check out the amazing life-saving work by Trp. Correa this morning!.'
